column1: Dara`a Governorate (Arabic: مُحافظة درعا‎ / ALA-LC: Muḥāfaẓat Dar‘ā ) is one of the fourteen governorates (provinces) of Syria. It is situated in the south-west of the country and covers an area of 3
column2: 730 km². It is bordered by Jordan to the south
column3: Quneitra Governorate and Israel to the west
column4: Rif Dimashq Governorate to the north and As-Suwayda Governorate to the east. The governorate has a population of 998
column5: 000 (2010 census office estimate). The capital is the city of Daraa.
